about that, to be honest.

2463.47.text:
I mean, I do think being in a
relationship with someone who

2467.58.text:
likes you makes you
like yourself more,

2471.63.text:
and I do think liking your
partner goes a long way.

2475.56.text:
I mean, I don't think we
talk about liking enough.

2477.96.text:
We talk about loving a lot, but
we don't talk that much about

2482.58.text:
And there's this thing
that psychologists

2485.49.text:
have written about called the
Michelangelo effect, which

2488.16.text:
is really if you see
the best in your partner

2491.37.text:
that they will aspire to become
the person you see in them.

2498.75.text:
So if your partner
sees the best in you,

2503.46.text:
then you will aspire to be
the person that they imagined.

2506.28.text:
So I suspect that
there's a huge benefit

2510.00.text:
in noticing the great
things about your partner

2513.45.text:
and paying attention to
them and complimenting them.

2516.99.text:
And this is something that I try
to do in my relationship a lot,

2523.96.text:
and it's also just nice
to be complimented.

2526.63.text:
So I would say be
in a relationship

2530.65.text:
with someone who
notices the good in you,

2533.78.text:
and notice the good
in other people.
